reviews_data.review_text: Still awesome.

Why call it a bakery at this location when you're just bringing it from your actual bakery and then freeze and  heating it all back up. Nothing is fresh at this location. The quiche tastes like water from being frozen and reheated. I could peel the hard cold cheese off of my quiche. The cinnamon roll, don't bother it is dry and has very little cinnamon gooeyness. The eggs were boxed eggs and spongy, and they were also precooked. They were sent back with the cold bacon that is also pre made ahead . They came back now brown from the turbo oven. If you can't pul off simple eggs and bacon, why offer it? The cappuccino were good once we figured out the server doesn't bring them to you. Why am I tipping ? I have to clear my own plates and you can't bring me my coffee & food? The kicker is when I spoke to the brunette female  at the counter  that I was told was the Mgr on duty at 12:30pm this day didn't care at all. Just let us walk out after explaining to her about our experience.  I know as an f&b Mgr myself you do everything to make the customer happy. She failed and should probably be retrained on basic customer service.

First the good part about Am√©lie's The cappuccino was very good. Unfortunately we can't say the same for the food we got. My wife order the quiche and it came half cold. If you pre-make the quiche, at least heat it up properly. The cheese on top was so hard and cold it just peeled off. I ordered the brioche french toast with scrambled eggs and bacon on the side. French toast was plain without any flavor besides the Syrup. But the biggest disappointment was the bacon and scrambled eggs. I mean pre-made bacon and eggs? My bacon and eggs both came cold, so I gave them back, asking for fresh made bacon and eggs, and I got pre- headed bacon and eggs again. They were brown and crispy For $35 I would expect at least fresh made bacon and eggs. Even Waffel House makes these two items fresh. Maybe come back for a coffee, but definitely not for the food.

Really enjoyed stopping by here with my friend. The baked goods and sandwiches are fairly priced for the area as well as very tasty. The service is fast and the vibe is kitschy. I like that no one tries to hurry you out and you can definitely sit here to chat for a while or potentially cowork.
(Translated by Google) Very good attention, and delicious food.  (Original) Muy buena atenci√≥n, y ricas comidas.

Ne mangez pas ici c'est une disgr√¢ce √† la culture fran√ßaise. This is an insult to French culture and gastronomy. Do not eat the macarons they are stale and not tasty at all. The decoration is tacky and they can't even spell French sentences correctly on their shop signs. I am offended this place claims to be ‚ÄúFrench‚Äù when it's nothing but an American joke. Please save yourself some time, money and food intoxication and don't stop here.
Seems to be a lot of rules posted, that are mildly off-putting.

I deeply appreciate that they don't charge extra for those of us that need gluten free bread for sandwiches! The soups and sammies are as tasty as always, and still a decent amount of GF options for those that need it. Macarons and chocolate mousse cups are üòòüëå The caramel apple French soda is not nearly as good as the crem√© brul√© French soda, bring that one back please!
Love Amelie's and this location is true to their atmosphere and quality of both staff and food.

4-5 stars for the food, 3 stars for the intermittent service.  I live nearby I've been going to amelies since they opened.  the minus stars is for the spotty service.  Sometimes its great, the food is good when they get it right.  I get a lot of food to go, it's about 60/40 on if they get to go food right.  Make sure to check what they gave you is what you want before you leave and you'll leave happy.  I've confirmed what i want on the sandwhich only to have them omit things i asked for and add things i didn't
The chocolate torte was excellent. The coffee is good. The ambience is very pretty. I was not happy with the macrons. They were hard and chewy.

First off I am a night owl ü¶â. We miss the 24hrs of the original location.It gave Charlotteans a sense grit and authenticity Sorry it feels like walking into Disneyland üè∞. It feels too polished and sterile. No vibe that feels welcoming to artists, poets, skateboarders etc. We loved the ‚Äúavant-garde‚Äù of the original location. The old piano, street performers and counter culture customers and staff. Way too overdone. It feels like a tourist destination now üëé the one place that was conjuring culture in charlotte and they #failedtheassignment

The manager of this location is EXTREMELY RUDE. After waiting almost 20 minutes for our drinks and finishing all of our meals, our drinks were finally called out and one of them was made incorrectly. The manager making the drinks literally said ‚Äúfantastic. It will be another 5 minutes.‚Äù Even though it was HIS fault he didn't follow the order correctly. I complained to the woman at the register and she said ‚Äúyeah‚Ä¶that's the manager.‚Äù As if that justifies his treatment of customers. I understand this location can get extremely busy. We get that, and we're patient. But, the least they can do is respect their customers. There needs to be better processes in place for those waiting for their drinks. It's one guy making them and shouting names and it's a large location. For those waiting outside they can't hear. Even for a simple orange juice there's a wait. Unfortunately we will not be returning to this location. It's just not worth the disrespect.
Appreciate you Adam!  Delicious baked goods, as always.
Best gluten free pastries I've ever tasted. Very friendly staff.
Excellent food, drinks, and service.
Delicious pastries and Sandwiches! Beautiful and cool theme inside! üòä
Kylie provided great, professional service and super sweet!

A gem of a place. Went to the original location back multiple times in the summer 2014 and I've been ranting and raving about it since. Flash forward to 2019 and they had one in Atlanta, unfortunately they closed after the lockdown.  Get your French fix of pasteies, croquet monisuers and caf√© without going to Paris!
Have a chocolate madeline!
Great atmosphere, great food and awesome staff!

This really isn't the place to get coffee. I bought a cappuccino recently and it was made very poorly. The drip coffee isn't very consistent either. The pastries have gone downhill in my opinion. I was surprised to see a few items that really should have been thrown out. It's "OK", but it's not anything to seek out. There are way better bakeries in Charlotte.
Never disappoints!
Decent food for a decent price. Nothing exceptional but a good bite. Restaurant decor is interesting and fun. Coffee is average. Best thing about this place seems to be the baked goods.
Julia was amazing! 10/10! Thank you so much. Friendly and amazing team.

Typical American style French looking pastries. Had high hopes after reading all the reviews, sadly the pastries are mediocre at best. Ordered Napoleon, Silk French Tart, Chocolate layer cake, Almond croissant and Raspberry Lemon tart. All items lacked their supposed flavor profile, the only thing you taste is sugar and nothing else.
ü§§ üòã I am from France and this place would put to shame some of the best Parisien bakeries! I wish they had places like this in Boston (where I live).
My bf and I are awe of the decorations! I enjoy their bakery and my bf order their lunch menu. They are delcious! The staff are extremely nice! Will come again!
I always enjoy coming here. The decor is amusing, the food is delicious, and the coffee is spot on. I highly recommend any of their locations.
Great atmosphere and prices are reasonable. The macaroons are big compared to the average size. I will recommend this location for a low drama date or casual talking.

This cute little (though not that little) cafe is such a must-go! The window delicacies are delicious! I had an eclair, a macaron, and cr√®me br√ªl√©e (which was heavenly).  I also had the Brie, bacon, and fig jam tartine (not pictured) which was to die for!
Amazing desserts and espresso. Great atmosphere beautiful art. The employees are very friendly. Great place to relax and talk.
Simply the most relaxing, cozy, delicious cafe experience in the Carolinas.

Great little French pastry and cafe.   We only came for some desserts and they were great.   A great variety and it was really good.   The decor and atmosphere could get you to think you were in an old France shop.   Treat yourself and go.

Love/hate relationship with this location.  Loved the vibes, the quirky French decorations, the staff. All are very fun and give you a 90's "Friends" feeling that I really enjoy.  I hated the food. The pastries were quite bad -- mushy and dull, and the coffee was bitter and quite bad. My companions got espresso drinks that were admittedly much better though.  It's worth coming for the vibes, but definitely not for the food.
Over cooked everything
Chocolate croissant chewy, like bread.

The owners have put a great deal of creativity and care into both the design and the execution of this delightful caf√©. It was a perfect place for a late morning snack - the tartine with fig, bacon, and Brie. The Brie was melted just right over a generously-buttered baguette - perfect with a latte.  I would recommend taking the time to really enjoy the art and atmosphere- this is not a place to rush through.
The staff was rude today! The girl behind the pastry counter literally was upset that I did not know the name of some of the pastries. Sorry I'm not a full time pastry server‚Ä¶overrated
This place is amazing! You will not regret coming here!

Came here TWICE this past week because the parents were in town and recently discovered Amelie's. We really enjoyed both visits!  The Good: first, the ambience is super cute! Kind of reminds me of an antique shop with French flair. As for the food, we all really enjoyed everything we tried. We tried several macaroons and multiple tarts. The tarts were the MVPs as they were delicious and not too sweet. The macaroons were also really good but were too sweet for all of us (none of us eat much sugar so we're all probably too sensitive to it). We also got some crustless quiches and chicken salad on croissant. My favorite was the chicken salad sandwich. The chicken wasn't fatty or gristly and seemed to be all white meat, which is my preference. The croissant was also insanely delicious and not stale as other reviews have mentioned. In fact, all of our pastries and food both times seemed to be really fresh.  The Meh: service wasn't the friendliest (except for the super nice lady who brought out our food - she was awesome). The ordering structure is confusing for newbies (see below) and I felt like the people working the pastry counter were impatient with us. There's a lot to look at within the pastry area and it may take some time to decide. They weren't busy when we came shortly after opening but I felt rushed making a decision on pastries.  The Bad: if you're new to Amelie's the ordering structure/process isn't clear and is confusing. One person takes pastry only orders and if you want anything else besides something in the pastry case, you have to place that order with a different person at the register. I get it but clear direction and patience would be appreciated. Apparently, if you order coffee, that comes out in the coffee bar area and not with your food. I think they call your name when your coffee order is ready but, due to the acoustics of the restaurant, I didn't hear a thing. Eventually, after I was almost done with my meal, I went in search for my latte and it was sitting on the counter. It would have been better if the cashier had let us know to watch out for our name or coffee at the coffee bar but I expected it to come out with my food. Like I said, I understand the structure of the food, pastry, coffee areas but staff were not helpful in communicating the process.  Overall, we really enjoy the food and the ambience so we will definitely be back when my parents come back!
I always have a great experience when I come here.  The macarons are so good and the breakfast sandwiches are always delicious.  They also have gluten free bread which is a huge plus!
Poor quality of services. Food taste is good . Coffee was served very cold !!
A lovely caf√© with good food, drinks, and atmosphere. I think everything is fairly priced, but the large pastries which are a little too high.
Lovely place in lovely neighborhood.
I absolutely love this place. My go to dessert is the pecan tart!
Great pastries!

The one star rating is due to very poor customer service and the inability of management there to professionally take into consideration legitimate customer comments. If it were not for decent pastries and good coffee, a zero star rating would be more accurate. However, the pastries are seriously over priced.  Amelies is not a good choice for those who only want coffee. The set up forces all customers to wait in what can be a very long and very slow moving pastry counter line. Even though there is potential for their second register to allow a separate coffee service line enabling better service to all customers, management refuses to implement this.  A friend I was with today wanted to bring this up again to the manager on duty and was met with obnoxious rudeness and unprofessionalism. The manager stated in a snarky tone that ‚Äúit is what it is and that there was a Starbucks up the road if he didnt like it.‚Äù I was shocked that a manger would act this way.  We took the managers suggestion and left. They lost 4 customers today. I will not give them my business ever again.
One of my favorites. Friendly staff and excellent food.
We use to have Amelie's on Atlanta and unfortunately is close. We were so happy to found it at Charlotte. Always excellent pastries and coffee.

I bought a cheese danish and a cinnamon bun. Both were stale and not fresh. I was so surprised considering my first visit was at the Davison street Amelie's bakery and everything was so fresh and delicious. I'm giving 2 stars because the service was great and the ambiance looked inviting. I'm sorry to say I couldn't say the same for the pastries.  I was so excited when I walked into this location and couldn't wait to bring my niece to this location since we enjoyed ourselves at the Davison street location.  Because the pastries were stale and dry, I will not bring her to this location.
Great food, drinks and atmosphere.  Employees are very nice and welcoming. We'll be back.
It's all so good! Croissants are delish.  Tarts are great.  Real bakery. Great atmosphere.

Stopped here for a leisurely breakfast with the family - inside is eclectically decorated, and the pastries artfully displayed.  The wife's cappuccino was well done, my espresso unfortunately served in a paper cup (even though we got the order to eat in) and a tad more bitter than I would expect.  Our pastries were delicious - flaky sweet and very fresh.  We ended up getting some macarons for the road to hold us over until lunch!

Croissant was harder than a brick, palmier was low average, hot chocolate was a powdered mix, so, what's the fuss about this place?  You might be impressed if you never had better.  Nice ambience though.

Why is the staff progressively getting more rude? This used to be my favorite stop on the way to work there's a guy named Brandon working the register who has been awful and arrogantly talking to customers, I wasn't going to leave a bad review until I saw someone else complain about him too.

Excellent selection of baked goods. The salted caramel brownie was fantastic, the espresso was decadent and rich, macaroons perfect, and crem br√ªl√©e was fresh and torched on site. I would give 5 more stars for the interior alone, eclectic and unique art. Stop looking around, this is the place!
Adorable and delicious! This place is cute and served up great quiches, sandwiches and pastries with excellent coffee. A bit hidden away, but that just adds to the charm.
Brandon, you're an a-hole I did not like your attitude don't work the front register

Terrible manager! We were there last week and ordered without a mask on no problem. Today we were treated like we had a terrible disease. Embarassing moment for me and the family and we will never go back.

It was terrible last week manager didn't ask us for mask and today all of a sudden it was ‚Äúrequired‚Äù we was treated like criminals ‚ÄúWe can't serve you‚Äù ‚ÄúYou have to leave‚Äù omg I was speechless!!! Discrimination at 100% never expected this down south I'm disgusted !!!! I would put 0 stars but it won't post !!!! Shame on Amelie's I thought they was better than that!!!!
Extremely cute French cafe. They have seasonal drinks, food, pastries and desserts in a very cute and interesting Parisian style venue. Service and food were great. Well priced too.

I don't know why, but I've reviewed this place like 10 times and my review and photos keep getting deleted.  We love Amelie's. Today, we took a family bike ride for breakfast sandwiches and macaroons! Staff was friendly, there are bike racks and outdoor heated/covered seating
Great ambience and very spacious for group of friends to hangout or work at. I never get bored of their macaroons and fruit tarts!!

i've been on the hunt for the best tasting coffee in charlotte. Amelies makes a pretty good americano & cappuccino. it's one the only coffee place around here I can drink without oat milk/syrups. they have amazing pistachio macaroons which is a french classic and my personal favorite. their sandwiches are great as well. I've been going to Amelies once a week for a year now and the staff has been 5 stars every time.
Employees looked and acted as if they'd rather be on a train track with a train coming than work there

My wife and I stopped going to Amelie's years ago, we found Burney's to have much better quality croissants, cookies and brownies.  I had to laugh when a buddy shared he experienced the same half-frozen Napoleon custard as I did.
The most pretty of the Amelies, super nice.

So my wife and I tried this place since we were in Charlotte. Saw the good reviews and said hey why not. Well‚Ä¶‚Ä¶. I've never seen dark meat in chicken salad and while I'm certainly not a professional chef , it just doesn't work. Not to mention there were bones in the chicken salad. My croque  Monsieur was decent. The tea for being in the south needs to be sweeter. Staff were sort of friendly. Sorry that was just the experience we had.

2018: Although I am happy for Amelie's recent expansions, I do have to say that the quality of their food - particularly the pastries- has gone way, way down. The croissants have no flavor and do not have crispy crusts, and their cakes likewise just taste like sugary bread. There's also a lack of consistency between the stores. :(  Update from 3 years ago: The Park Rd. location pleasantly surprised today. The pastries (petit gateau and eclair) were moist, flavorful and robust. Delicious!

This is the second Am√©lie's location that I've been to and I love the funky decor!there is a wide selection of dessert options in addition to delicious food and drinks. But above all else, the staff is so friendly and kind.
The salted caramel bars and the cafe au lait macaroons are delicious!!
A free eclair on your birthday!  The mushroom(champignon) duxelle tartine is melted with gruyere cheese.  Their signature is the salt water caramel brownie, a must try.
Wonderful food, Staff, facility/ atmosphere! Highly recommend, always a positive experience!
Very cute place with great pastries. Friendly staff.
Love Love this cute French bakery & cafe (also has beer & wine) - a true gem with great service, atmosphere, & food - unique & funüíï

Came here after a couple awful experiences at our hotel's restaurant and it was a refreshing change. I got the ham + turkey + bacon sandwich and my wife had a breakfast sandwich on a croissant. We also had the most decadent salted caramel brownie latte. The food was delicious and the atmosphere was great!
Great place, great staff, great bakery! Please come back to Atlanta...

In my opinion, this place is overrated. I have tried several things such as the French soda, (not a fan at all). Desserts I guess are ok, would not buy them again. They are expensive. 5 dollars for a piece of dessert? What? Anyway, they should start paying attention to ‚Äúspecific‚Äù instruction when placing the order online. I ordered a sandwich and they put Mayo. I was already long gone.I came in today to get a quiche and the cafe marcotter. The coffee loses its taste halfway  and the quiche on the outside was really dry. However I liked how it tasted on the inside. The lady that gave me my order did not give me straws and didn't notice until I was at my car. I had to walk all the way back to the store. When people get drinks, you got to give them the straws. Whatever.  This specific location Im going to have to stop going to.  Maybe the other locations are better.  Where this place located is very weird. The first time I went to this place, I got lost. How about you all try being in the front of the area, or find a better location.

Best coffee shop in town. The food and pastries are excellent as well. The staff is always nice and Allana specifically has gone above and beyond to make us feel welcome. Definitely recommend to anyone who wants to try somewhere new.

I have always loved this place which is why it's hard for me to leave a bad review. This is the first time I ever went to the Park Road location. Inside was very clean and quaint. Ordered an iced coffee (pretty good) and also ordered the chicken salad croissant and the chicken broccoli cheddar soup. The soup was basically broccoli with hot water. No cheesy flavor, and only one piece of chicken in the whole soup. The chicken salad was not that great either. I have always enjoyed their coffee and baked goods, but I don't think Amelie's has mastered prepared foods.

The pastry and banana latte were excellent! The service was amazing and the atmosphere is very eclectic. Unfortunately we came at a very busy time on a Sunday morning and had a bit of a bad run-in with the barista.
It was very nice to be able to sit outside in the sunshine with my friend. It was very disheartening to see that inside there was no seating at all.

I understand that popularity comes at a cost, but more than 30 minutes for one cup of coffee and breakfast sandwiches means this place is dead to me.  If you are in any sort of rush, I can't recommend coming here... On weekends at least.
(Translated by Google) Heaven on earth!  (Original) Paradis sur terre!
I'm at a lack of words to describe how good this is. Thank you for this experience.
Great as usual!

This hidden gem is a MUST! I have visited the other location in NODA. If you love French things, food, bakery, decor-this place is for you. An absolute dream. And the pastries!!!!!!! Gather your girlfriends, put on a beret & go experience this treasure!
Never felt particularly welcome here, I've gone a few times when I should've stopped at the first. Won't be back.
First time here and I was impressed! Great little bakery/ Cafe with indoor and outdoor seating. Delectable treats for someone with a sweet tooth!!

Hi Patricia! I wanted to thank you and the entire Am√©lie's catering team for making our event special. Everyone loved the food and commented on how it was the best thus far. Well packaged/ labeled, everything was as ordered, condiments, serve ware , all presented beautifully, especially the macaron, and deeelicious! Please thank everyone and know that Grant represented Amelies perfectly - prompt , courteous, helpful and just a nice guy! Yay Team Amelie!!
This is my first time here, and I will be visiting every Tuesday while my son is at King Tiger TKD.
We enjoyed this location also. Larger seating area, same quirky decorations. Enjoyed our pastries and breakfast sandwiches.
One of the best places to get macarons. There food is delicious as well.

Always clean and friendly.  Jason was especially helpful.  There was a miscommunication on my part with a drink order and he gladly took care it.  Great place for meeting and getting your creative juices going!
The food is fabulous! The decor alone will keep bringing me back. I love the ambiance in this beautiful French Bakery. The staff & owner is amazing! I'm hooked ü§©

Am√©lie's reminds me of a Paris patisserie. Great selection of fresh desserts that are very tasty. I highly recommend their fresh fruit tarts! There is plenty of room to sit and eat inside or out. The staff behind the counter were friendly and helpful even though I had a lot of questions. The quirky decorating was an added visual bonus.
Excellent food and drink!
It was so good can't wait to visit again!!
Clean, good staff, good pastries.
The deserts/pastries are crazy good and with a great presentation.
Their croissants are amazing...light and flaky!  Very nice atmosphere.
Great new experience! Cool museum-like caf√©. Will most likely return!

Travel to Paris through the senses! The scent of a bakery and coffee greet you as you approach the cafe. As you step in off the street, your ear catches something different, the beautiful music of a mixture of language.  You step inside and realize, you have entered Paris. Everything from the delightful decor to the astounding pastry creations tell you you've transported to a Parisian Cafe.  You can pour over their menu, and debate the choice of which dessert to try.  But feel free to just order anything because it all is delicious!  When the food arrives you can feel the difference in your hands, the crisp of the bread, and the softness of the cheese. Then you eat‚Ä¶and it's heaven!
Fantastic little bakery and cafe. Very friendly staff with terrific range of treats and food. I'm saving this place on my favorites!
Nice vibe. Good food.
Very fun bakery with a very impressive menu. Took a while to decide what we wanted because I didn't want to miss out on anything. Food and pastries were good, so we will definitely be coming back!
Eclectic decor and delicious desserts! The apple tart was amazing.
Do not deny yourself this treat. Visit them and you won't regret it. They have so much room to sit. The food, the drinks and the deserts are the best around. Coming back was like coming back home.
Delicious food and friendly staff.
Great food drink and ambience

I've been to this location several times when in the area.  The staff is friendly and the restaurant is clean.  I've just yet to try anything that I just love. My family does love the fresh fruit tarts.  Lately I've been getting the cinnamon rolls but maybe I should start asking when they are made as they end up being so hard like they've been sitting there for days.  Trying to like this place but it's just average to me.  I don't get the hype.
bring back delivery, i beg of thee
You deserve a treat. You deserve the best. Why not get both at Amelie's? I can't express enough how good the food is. Raspberry lemon tart is the best. Treat yo self.

I have had good experiences here, but the last couple times I have come there has been issues and the staff has been rude and at this price the quality and service isn't there. Would no longer recommend
Excellent, GREAT DESSERTS!!
Love this location. Amazing french pastries.  We got salads and sandwiches and coffee too. The strawberry salad with almonds and goat cheese was AMAZING.  Always a treat here!
It was good overall, but one thing ordered was an sweetened iced coffee, it either wasn't sweetened or not enough. Everything else was great, though.
It was a great, laid back little coffee and bakery house. I had a small iced coffee with some friends and it was phenomenally great coffee.  Highly recommended...!!!
Fun bakery, great pastries and coffee
Beautiful pastries
The selection of pastries is incredible. Everything is fresh and the staff is very cordial.
terirble attention.  There was only one seller and he really seemed very annoying and disinterested in serving us correctly
Great service and food!
The strawberry goat cheese salad was so good
Bakery was clean and well distanced. The bakery items are pretty good.

I've been disappointed with the quality the last few times I've gone there. I got the cinnamon bun this time, and it was stale.  I wish I'd taken it back but I thought it was just stale on the outside, but it proved me wrong.
Delicious pastries and coffee.
Great drinks and treats. Love the atmosphere

I had an eclair with vanilla custard and completely forgot the name of the other but here's a picture of it. They were so yummy for that sweet craving. The one with the strawberry is surprisingly not as sweet as it looks it was perfect. Thanks Amelie's
Oh my gosh! Best pastries ever!  Can't wait to go back. The 100 miles from my home was so wirth the drive! Thank you!!!!
Great pastries nice team
It's very good, and delicious!
Desserts never disappoint and neither does the service!
Very good
All time favorite bakery in Charlotte so far..
Really delicious pastries, sandwiches, and coffee. Lovely atmosphere. Not sure if it's the large crowds or something, but the outside trash cans seem to be full every time I go.
Amazing breakfast sandwiches and tartines, as usual!

We trusted Amelie's park road to cater the desserts served at our wedding reception. Both the bride and I not being fans of cake elected to serve assorted desserts, and chose Amelie's based upon our past experiences ordering at the chain and their reputation. The bride and I love creme brulee and placed special significance on an individual serving that we were to "tap" simultaneously to break the crust. We ordered, paid and tipped days in advance and expected the tray of assorted desserts and a vanilla creme brulee to be ready. Upon pick up we learned first that Amelie's had not made our vanilla creme brulee that day and that they only had chocolate. I was flexible and agreed that we would take a chocolate instead, however they were also running out of the supply of the chocolate. While the staff presented their issue, the last creme brulee was served to another customer. The worst part was, I saw it walk out the door. The staff that day first failed to fulfill a pre-paid catering order, they failed to hold a product to the side to be received by a prepaying customer, and they failed to notify us of any issue in advance of pick up. Look, if you want a quick cup of coffee or an afternoon snack, Amelie's can adequately meet those needs, but in the case of catering they fall flat on their face. Their lack of oversight and accountability eliminated what was to be a special moment between my bride and I, a moment that we cannot get back.
My wife and I enjoyed our visit and will come again
There is NO dining onside, even for a macroon. Ridiculous.
Good good but a bit pricey for the quantity.
Delicious fresh baked goods with a very quirky and fun atmosphere!
Fantastic variety of French pastries. Everything that we ordered was delicious. Only downside is that you can't dine in.
One of the first places I go when I visit Charlotte. Wonderful tea, yummy sandwiches, and macarons to DIE for!

The atmosphere is nice but not the food. The very last time I visited I got three pastries and they were just way too sweet and heavy. Also $18 for three pastries was just a little over (or maybe that's just the new Charlotte standard now?). There are way better French bakery in the area where the head chef is actually French. If you want real French bakery food you should go check out other places. But if you're only interested in the atmosphere and then go ahead.
excellent pastry

They have several locations in Charlotte, with this one being the newest, I believe. To start, you'll find an eclectic atmosphere that maintains an obvious French theme. It feels like they've been there since Charlotte was a fledgling trading post. The variety and quality of their coffee is probably the feature that keeps most folks coming back again and again, but if you try the pastries, you're in for a real treat. See pics. They have outdoor seating for those cool mornings and long afternoons... and the much less glamorous COVID restrictions days.

One of the best bakeries in Charlotte. The cheese danish, caramel latte, macaroon, Fruit tart, pecan tart, and croissants are a must! The service is great and the interior design is unique. The entrance is located on the back of the building and there is large outdoor seating. Absolutely love Amelie's bakery ‚ú®üôå
Love it, food to die for. Russian tea 8s the best
Omg cinnamon sticks were sooooo good
Hard to walk out of this place without a little bit of everything.

Do not order a custom cake - only enjoy their desserts from the counter!!

The peach stuffed croissant was too heavy and saturating. The banana split cake was not a cohesive dessert- I only tasted banana and nothing else! My partner only tasted raspberry- basically the ingredients didn't come together- it was odd to say the least. The sticky bun was horrible tasting. The salted caramel brownie was a joke as we neither tasted any caramel nor salt. The chocolate ganache was below average. The Napoleon was interesting but not something I would eat again. The savory dishes were even worse, if you can believe it! The quiche had burnt crust, it was not light and fluffy as one would expect. We also ordered a tartine with fig, bacon and Brie. When we got the plate, we saw no figs, after taking a bite or two, we realized that they had applied fig jam very sparingly on the bread! The bacon was over cooked - some were burnt! They put so little brie that I didn't even taste it. And to top it all, the hot chocolate was not even hot! I will not do the mistake of going there again!

No decaf espresso. Macarons were just okay in flavor and texture. Some we're very hard to bite into. The salted caramel torte was very good - it hit the spot! The decor is neat.
This is one of my favoritr pastry place in the city. It's a French bakery with variety of selection. They serve good food and good drinks. People are nice and accommodating.
The best coffee!!!!!!
Really good
The pastries are a bit sugary and sweet for being "French".  The atmosphere is very cute.

This is probably my favorite Amelie's location. It is in the back of Park Road shopping center behind Micheals. There is plenty of parking and the inside is very spacious and well decorated with plenty of seating. All staff is friendly and helpful. The coffee and tea are delicious and they had all of their usual desserts as well as sandwiches and soups. My favorite is a hot vanilla chai latte! Give it a try!
Great place to meet up or study or just relax. Food is pricey but fantastic. Coffee is so so

One of their finer locations with a wonderful staff. Amelie's collections of pastry and cakes are delicious as always. But it's sad that don't have a single vegetarian/Vegan sandwich.  Wouldn't recommend this place for lunch for vegetarians.
The place is fun.

I called to inquire about availability of savory croissants. Why would you lie and say you had an item on the menu when you don't?? Literally stood in line and walked out when they didn't have it. I'm not going to spend money after you lie to me, so what was the actual point of lying? To get me in the door? Well I loved this chain and will never be back.

I will likely not return to this location; on a Saturday lunch visit it more resembled Chuckie Cheese than a French bakery. Toddlers screaming, kids running around, coughing everywhere and not covering their mouths, parents not caring... A woman with 3 children took a table for 2 next to us and squeezed the kids in, with their piles of toys, and stood (with her butt ON my table) until the people on the other side took off. I was also quite surprised to receive a croque monsieur on a croissant; it may have been in the description, but that's just not how the sandwich is ever made.

The best place in town for coffee a pastry and conversation. My wife and kids love this place.
Great pastries of various kinds, good coffee, and tasty sandwiches. The space itself is decorated in all sorts of interesting ways, giving both a general French vibe as well as a arts space.

I called Amelies and ordered a breakfast to pick up and paid over the phone. When I got to Amelies to get my order I asked the Barista where I should get it from. She was instantly rude and very unhelpful. I decided to stand by the register and saw my to-go bag behind the counter. The barista then yells at me "You're going to have to wait in line like everyone else." I then told her my bag is right there and completely paid for and she then turned away. I work in retail, there is ABSOLUTELY no reason to speak with anyone that way. If you wake up on the wrong side of the bed that morning, there's no reason it needs to be taken out on any customer. I am so disappointed in my experience and will not be eating at Amelies anymore.

Who doesn't love Amelie's? It's a Charlotte staple. I've been to the NoDa and Uptown locations but this was my first time at the Park Road location. We had dinner at the backlot so we decided to walk over for some dessert.  It's a pretty nice space. It's pretty big and very open. There's a patio outside, but there's no food or drink allowed out there which is interesting.  We got a few macarons (birthday cake, caramel apple, and smores), a pumpkin macaron ice cream sandwich, and a spiced pumpkin and cream cheese entrement. Everything was delicious, but the ice cream sandwich was my favorite!  If you've never been to Amelie's before, it's definitely a must try!
"Melt in your mouth" an old phrase, truthful description of the frosting on the cake here. Other treats are every bit as good, coffee's rich also. The coconut macaroons are my simple favorite!

Great little bakery with all kinds of treats. They have coffee, soups and other food options. However I go for their sweets. Their macarons are so good! My favorite are the cinnamon chocolate ganache and pistachio.

Bright and clean.  Perfect place to meet for coffee and conversation or for a working lunch or for a time alone to write..  Try all the macaron flavors and the asparagus leek soup.  They make accommodations for vegetarians and the staff behind the counter are knowledgeable about the products and glad to help you make choices.  I always plan my eating on the way to the store.  Yum.

My family has recently discovered Am√©lie's and it has become a staple in our daily routine. I love all of their vegan and vegetarian options such as their tartines, breakfast sandwiches, and soups. All the staff are friendly and make you feel like family. Coffee is always freshly brewed with different options daily. The decor is eclectic and cheerful filled with various colors and textures. Be sure to visit whenever in Charlotte.

This Amelie's is a pretty cool location. I've been to other locations before in Charlotte, but this one is unique for its location. It's hard to find your first time in the shopping center, but once you find it it's awesome! Parking is free and not terrible unlike the uptown location parking where you have to pay. Overall, it's a great spot.
The newest Amelie's in Charlotte is fantastic. Plenty of room and it's bright and airy. Unlike the NODA location, the lines are reasonable and I can always find a seat.

This was so fun! The decorations alone make this place worth it. A funny French tasty that doesn't take itself too seriously, except in its food. And the food is seriously good. I got a breakfast sandwich with spinach, tomato, and asiago on a croissant. So flaky, buttery (the tomato skins made the sandwich a little messy and hard to eat, but I'm not splitting hairs). My wife got some kind of salted caramel brownie that was just great. And the coffee was spot on. Plenty of space to spread out, take in the hilarious Van Gogh with ear bandage and all, and just enjoy something decadent with friends, family, or a good book. Highly recommend.
10 out of 10 would recommend

The croissant was hard and crumbly, instead of the usual buttery flakiness; there wasn't much bacon, and it had very little flavor.  What was more dissappointing was that I waited almost 20 minutes for them to prepare it, when there were very few customers.

Great hidden gem behind the regular brunch spots. Ample parking and no crowd for the Sunday 11am time slot. Great open space inside & lots of seating! Decor is a funky French take, counter ordering, separate bar for alcoholic and coffee pickup vs. Menu/sweets and table delivery of food order.  Ordered the make your own breakfast sandwich and a cafe au lait üòã and a passionfruit strawberry mimosa for dessert!  Definitely a new favorite brunch spot! Outdoor seating area need more umbrellas for the tables but still very cute!

I visited with my family. We had a great experience. The food was good!

Great place to stop and recharge after walking the 8-mile greenway trail! This venue was trendy, clean, wild, and the servers seemed to be very friendly and welcoming! Unfortunately, their menu had very little to offer me and mine. Now, I didn't eat here, but they were kind enough to direct us to the complimentary water dispenser that they installed JUST for people like us! The wall art was a little distracting, but they really do seem to have a passion for their work that cannot be denied. Tacky, bright, and a little pretentious, but most assuredly an oasis for anyone out in the hot summer sun. Stop in, and see it for yourself!

I've visited 2 of the locations and impressed with the feel of both for intimacy and relaxation!  The flavors...a big fat YUM! Its tucked away behind the shops - (behind Michaels). Wi-Fi is great!  Lots of space, speedy service (compared to NODA location), good selection of yummy baked goods and a few sandwich selections.  Reasonable pricing and friendly staff!  Today I chose the Key Lime Tart and a Salted Caramel Brownie both were good!
